content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: tout marche bien et cet challenge est trop cool

To better catch incorrect length calculations (especially if using log2 to calculate), one of the test sets should be updated so the max values are powers of 2. The A=1 test will already catch some issues but not all.

The easiest to update would probably be the 0 test cases by adding 8 as an input for the test and 16 as an input for the validator.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I solved it in just under 5 minutes (Python3).
Here are some problems I ran into (regarding my code) while solving:
* Had to pad with leading spaces instead of trailing spaces
* Output cannot have extra \n at the end.
Otherwise, this would be a great puzzle for people to solve!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Other people need to approve!! - I do really like this idea!

As suggested by various people, I've removed shortest.
And as suggested by Jp82, I both ensured numbers won't be larger than 255 and gave the value of N as an input.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Nice clash - I wouldn't be able to solve this in under a minute as with some other clashes! I do think that "shortest" would be quite difficult here though, as it would take people nearly half the 15 minute time to actually solve the problem.

Hi @TJTrickster !
-> yes, in Python, you can easily split an input string to [[n]] space separated parts,
-> but for some others languages helping, i suggest you to provide firstly a separate line with the corresponding [[n]] value ;-) ...

Maybe you can add a line in the Constraints to specify than each value will be less or equal than 255 (corresponding to A <= 8) :-) ?

=> I upvoted for you.

Good clash, good time to do, fun, not hard but need to think a bit. I wonder if size of code is good here. Because It's non an easy one, and for me, size of code clashes need to be a bit simpler, because if I take 5 minutes here, I won't have time to optimise for a long time, so I prefer easier clashes to be on size mode.

Nice clash!

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/865422233da6cfe25cb00e970cc6b9fcf0920

Goal
* Please format "*" as a {{constant}}.

Output
* Please delete "Next".

* Please format "A" as a [[variable]].

* Suggest to add a reminder that all leading and trailing spaces should be kept in the output.

Cases
* Suggest to add a pair of cases where all the input numbers are either 0 or 1.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write asterisks and spaces").

Thanks.

The other upload was deleted, I thought it didn't go through the first time around.
The new case was added, moving some of the later cases back.
I also updated my solution after learning it didn't work when A=1.
Thanks for commenting.

Good point.
I decided I'd instead add test cases as a personal preference.
Thanks for catching that.

Input
* Line 1: Please include the type and the description of the variable, e.g.

<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of integers to be included in the binary representation.

Thanks.
